intro: Hemitelia setosa, commonly known as the hairy hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Hemitelia setosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
